[Home](./index.md) &gt; [blockly](./blockly.md) &gt; [INavigationPolicy](./blockly.inavigationpolicy.md)

## INavigationPolicy interface

A set of rules that specify where keyboard navigation should proceed.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export interface INavigationPolicy<T> 
```

## Methods

|  Method | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [getFirstChild(current)](./blockly.inavigationpolicy.getfirstchild.md) | Returns the first child element of the given element, if any. |
|  [getNextSibling(current)](./blockly.inavigationpolicy.getnextsibling.md) | Returns the peer element following the given element, if any. |
|  [getParent(current)](./blockly.inavigationpolicy.getparent.md) | Returns the parent element of the given element, if any. |
|  [getPreviousSibling(current)](./blockly.inavigationpolicy.getprevioussibling.md) | Returns the peer element preceding the given element, if any. |
|  [isApplicable(current)](./blockly.inavigationpolicy.isapplicable.md) | Returns whether or not this navigation policy corresponds to the type of the given object. |
|  [isNavigable(current)](./blockly.inavigationpolicy.isnavigable.md) | <p>Returns whether or not the given instance should be reachable via keyboard navigation.</p><p>Implementors should generally return true, unless there are circumstances under which this item should be skipped while using keyboard navigation. Common examples might include being disabled, invalid, readonly, or purely a visual decoration. For example, while Fields are navigable, non-editable fields return false, since they cannot be interacted with when focused.</p> |
